brief_description: Microbiome alteration in response to influenza vaccine
brief_title: Investigating Alterations to the Nasal Microbiome after Vaccination with LAIV
description: The goal of this proposal is to characterize alterations to the nasal microbiome after vaccination with the 2012-2013 seasonal LAIV and to correlate these changes with LAIV-specific immune responses (A/California/7/2009 (H1N1) and A/Victoria/361/2011 (H3N2)).
hypothesis: Specific Aim 1: Measure changes in the nasal microbiome after vaccination with LAIV using high-throughput sequencing analysis of 16S rRNA genes; Correlate baseline and changes to the nasal microbiome after vaccination with LAIV vaccination with inter-individual differences in influenza-specific mucosal immune responses
objectives: Specific Aim 1: Measure changes in the nasal microbiome after vaccination with LAIV using high-throughput sequencing analysis of 16S rRNA genes; Correlate baseline and changes to the nasal microbiome after vaccination with LAIV vaccination with inter-individual differences in influenza-specific mucosal immune responses
official_title: Investigating Alterations to the Nasal Microbiome after Vaccination with LAIV

program.contract_name: Bioinformatics Approach to Influenza A/H1N1 Vaccine Immune Profiling
